comments.body: The Sirens should spawn in ocean biomes and have a appearance that is a mix between a mermaid and a harpy.

Did you know sirens are creatures in Greek mythology that lure sailors to their death and then bite their faces off.

No, change their names. If sirens did exist in-game, they'd be in the overworld on some island in the middle of the sea, not the end, and they'd be hostile. It's strange to let a face-eating vulture singer lady spawn in the End and lead you through it. Some other creature, maybe, but not sirens.
I was thinking the same think Orithyus! Although my version is a mix between original sirens and modern sirens. Which would be a mix between a Harpy and a Mermaid.
They should rather be called Screechers as sirens are from Greek myth.
that sounds so cool!
Cool but why a ravine specifically
Chainmail armor has the durability of iron armor, so idk how thats gonna work out

I think it maybe fun With nether update !
Thinking about magma block land and spawn fire anemones !
These could be farmable. This would add to the theme of the nether update perfectly!
Me  and my brother never have gotten fire resistance on minecraft in survival mode so i think its great
yeah it would be great!
Hmm, tbh I've always thought of ravagers as the pillagers failed attempts at making a iron golam. I do agree that they need better drops for how strong they are though

villagers and other pets should be immune to the sweep attack aswell, it could be an enchantment called friendly sweep, that makes villagers and any tamed pet by the player immune to the sweep attack used by a sword enchanted with this, they could still get damaged if they get hit direcly by it

"Like" why is this not a thing in the game, I love eating honeycomb in real life. It could give you 2 hearts of health.

Plus make honey in a bottle give you 4 hearts like steak. Makes more sense as you get 1 honey to 3 honeycomb.
Honeycombs should be chewed for a long time.
Good idea
Good idea

I think that instead of them behaving like tamed wolves, they could be more domesticated in the sense that, they follow the player ( if tamed) wether or not they have a lead, or they just invent a whistle or down item to get the tamed llamas attention.
Thats kind of what i refered to with the "behave like tamed wolves" in the fact that theyd follow the player and TP to them if they are too far,
Should be called Ender Demon or End Stalker
i like this idea but i think i can make it better by making it so after you kill the ender god you can tame the ender dragon
The End already has a boss. That would make the Ender Dragon useless.

Here is what I think the kelpie should be. Yes, a drowned zombie horse, but it won't do any damage. Instead, it will swim towards you, and if it touches you, you begin to ride it. Then, the kelpie will swim to the lowest part of the body of water that it can go to, and it will drown you. You can't hurt the kelpie once you're riding it, but nearby dolphins will attack nearby kelpies
This sounds awesome!
I think zombie horses and kelpies should be the same thing, and it should disguise itself as a normal horse and reveal its true form and attack when you try to ride it.
I like this idea a lot, I made a suggestion a lot like this just now and then I came across your post XD. Yeah, this would be awesome.
You had me at "Overworld's darkest corners".
I don't think you should fight them. It's cringy to discover that dinosaurs are still alive... And then kill them.

Maybe instead of dinosaurs, they could be gigantic sedimentary creepers, and you have to kill them before they blow up. When killed, they drop a bunch of gunpowder and bone blocks. They could spawn in large, isolated caves.
I agree. It's kinda weird how the animal gets burned on the campfire before your eyes, but drops raw meat. Mojang should definitely fix this.
They drop sponges?
Hello Jaylen Winiecki. I very much like this idea, can I use this item in my upcoming post?

No guys. Have the elder guardian drop the heart of the sea. It makes perfect sense. The wither drops a nether star, so why not? Also, just finding them in chests is so boring and I think we need a good ocean boss, so how about have the elder guardian spawn in a big room under the ocean monument for a more engaging fight rather than just crammed into the tiny space inside the monument. There could also be a few guardians in there with the elder to add a bigger challenge. A good boss fight should be one where the boss has the advantage, and you really have to be creative to win. Killing the elder guardian right now seems way too easy for what the presentation of the temple makes it seem like it should.
See, having trophies like this would make killing bosses so much more enjoyable.

The eye should definitely be the drop and be used to make a Mining Fatigue Potion too. Elder Guardians only spawn once in their temples so this would be a very rare potion and make guardian temples more considered to travel to.

Minecraft has a lack of birds and puffins are awesome!

You got my vote.

puffins are amazing and there are so many ways to integrate them into the game
Puffins are my favorite animal in the world and I would love to see them in Minecraft

I added "shared ownership" because I felt that summed up what you were looking for here the best just so people interested in this topic could find it easier. If that's not right just let us know.

I would like this. Mainly because they should drop slime balls when they sneeze.
You could just make phantoms spawn naturally in the void and come out of it to enforce sleep. they would remain below the end islands in the end.
So your saying that if a phantom spawns regularly, it will be nuetral, but if the player hasnâ€™t slept in 3+ days, the phantom will be neutral?

+TheFriendlyPine

No, I said that if the player hasn't slept in 3+ days it would be hostile towards that player. The Phantom would also be hostile if the player attacks it, regardless of days slept. In any other cases, the Phantom is neutral.
sorry I had a typo. At the end, I ment aggresive, not neutral.

Lol it's fine

But yes, that is the idea

I just want to be able to encounter phantoms more often. It's exciting to have a new hostile mob that attacks completely differently to other mobs. Having to "not sleep" sounds like a neat spawning condition at first but is dumb when you think about it for more than a second.

Yes, we need this! I've never been able to get Phantoms for some reason. I stay up for so many in game days and don't see a single one! I don't have it on Peaceful but they still won't spawn. It's so annoying and I hope it can get fixed.

I'm sorry I do not know why it was translated into Spanish and it lacked a part because my mouse swims very, very badly, the left button, layers so I fanta a message art and also layers that translate it into a google translator, in the translator translates anything, I do not speak or write in English I write in Spanish because I am Argentine.

I had an idea for a mob that would make aquatic zones extremely dangerous, but still survivable. In certain myths, sirens and mermaids were known to drag people underwater and drown them. Well what would happen such a mob existed? It could be a type of hostile mob that generally appears just below the surface of water. This hypothetical mob won't do base damage, but will instead drag players underwater until killed. It will certainly take players by surprise if these mobs can jump out of the water and drag players down that way. Kind of how magma block streams get players down extremely quickly but difficult to come back up. THAT would especially push coop players to stay on their toes and force anyone to be prepared before even thinking of going out to the water.
Bom mob poderia ser um Boss

the ender dragon constantly tries to hit everything it touches, except for other ender dragons, end crystals, and several other mobs, that's why it hits enderman, also, this would be too big of a change, it wouldn't really be minecraft anymore
